    • Field Detail

      • players

        private static Player[] players
        Array of players. As players run out of chips they are not removed from the array, but they are permanently folded.

      • cardsOnTable

        private static Card[] cardsOnTable
        Community cards currently in play. Note this array does not contain the cards that each player has been dealt

      • round

        private static int round
        Integer used to describe the current phase of the game. Used by the AI to determine when the AI should fold when they have no hand.

      • pot

        private static int pot
        Integer representing the current amount of chips that have been bet on this hand.

      • sc

        private static java.util.Scanner sc
        Scanner used to get input from user.

      • highScores

        private static HighScore[] highScores
        Array to store the current high scores.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • play

        private static void play()

      • deal

        private static void deal(Deck deck)

      • startNewGame

        private static void startNewGame()
        Called at the end of each hand. If a player has folded, but still has chips they are allowed back into the next hand. If a player has no chips their fold flag is set to prevent them from playing in future games.

      • findBestHand

        private static void findBestHand(Player player)
        Runs player hand through all hand determination methods (from best to worst) to determine what hand the player has. Once the hand has been determined the player is given the hand. At any one time, the player should have the best possible hand available stored as their hand. This method handles most of the logic related to the construction of the best possible hand. buildHand merely gives the selected cards to the player as a hand.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who's hand is to be evaluated

      • buildHand

        private static void buildHand(Card[] hand,
                              Player player)
        Builds the best possible hand as determined by findBestHand and gives it to the proper player. Called from findBestHand.
        Parameters:
        hand - The best hand found
        player - The player the hand belongs to.

      • takeBets

        private static void takeBets()
        Prompts user for input and places user bet. Once the AI bets are determined with determineAIBet they are placed as well. If a player or CPU bets 0 chips this is considered folding.

      • determineAIBet

        private static int determineAIBet(Player player)
        Determines the value of an AI's hand. The value is taken from the Hand class. Based on the value the AI places a certain bet or folds.
        Parameters:
        player - The AI that is currently betting.
        Returns:
        an integer value representing the AI's bet.

      • sortHand

        private static Card[] sortHand(Card[] hand)
        Sorts the hand high -> low based on value of cards.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be sorted.
        Returns:
        an array of cards sorted from high to low.

      • containsStraightFlush

        private static Tuple containsStraightFlush(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand is a straight flush.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        A tuple of (-1,-1) if there is no straight flush (1, index) if there is a normal straight. Index here is the index of the lowest card in the straight. If an ace low straight is present return (2, index).

      • containsFourOfAKind

        private static int containsFourOfAKind(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand contains four of the same card.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        The index of the final card from the four of a kind.

      • containsFullHouse

        private static Tuple containsFullHouse(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand contains a full house.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        A tuple of (-1,-1) if there is no full house. If there is a full house a non negative tuple is returned. The first index corresponds to the last occurrence of the triple. The second index is the last occurrence of the double.

      • containsStraight

        private static Tuple containsStraight(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand is a straight.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        A tuple of (-1,-1) if there is no straight (1, index) if there is a normal straight. Index here is the index of the lowest card in the straight. If an ace low straight is present return (2, index).

      • containsFlush

        private static java.lang.String containsFlush(Card[] hand)
        Determines whether a hand contains a flush.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        If there is a flush return a String representation of the suit. If there is not a flush return null.

      • containsThreeOfAKind

        private static int containsThreeOfAKind(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand contains a three of a kind.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the final index of the triple. If a triple is not present return -1.

      • containsTwoPair

        private static Tuple containsTwoPair(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand contains two pairs.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        If there is a pair return a tuple representing the indices. The index of the final element of the greater pair should be the first value of the tuple and the index of the final element of the smaller pair should be the second value of the tuple. If there are not two pairs return (-1,-1).

      • containsPair

        private static int containsPair(Card[] hand)
        Tests whether a hand contains a pair.
        Parameters:
        hand - The hand to be tested.
        Returns:
        If the hand contains a pair return the index of the final element of the pair. If there is not a pair return -1.

      • endGame

        private static void endGame()
        Called from startNewGame() if player declines to play another round or is out of chips. This method determines if the players score is a high score and if it is the writeNewScore method is called. If the player has not made a high score the high scores are displayed and the game exits.

      • writeNewScore

        private static void writeNewScore()
        This method creates a new HighScore for the player and inserts it into the proper position in the highScores array. The scores are then displayed and written to the high_scores.dat file.
